DOC.brief_summary: The WORLD study single-center , year-long randomize controlled trial free-living woman . Participants randomly assign follow either lower-fat ( LF ) diet moderate-fat ( MF ) diet weight management parallel-arm design . The two phase study weight-loss phase ( phase 1 ) weight-maintenance phase ( phase 2 ) ( Figure 1 ) . During phase 1 , month 1 4 , participant consume hypo-caloric diet consistent 2005 Dietary Guidelines free-living environment . During phase 2 , month 5 12 , participant shift weight maintenance . It hypothesize weight-loss intervention extreme dietary fat recommendation 2005 Dietary Guidelines would equally effective weight loss achieve comparable nutrient adequacy . Also , Overall , lower-fat moderate-fat diet would nutritionally adequate , base Healthy Eating Index .
DOC.brief_title: The WORLD ( Weight Optimization : Revamping Lifestyles Using Dietary Guidelines ) Study - Developing , Implementing , Testing Education Program
DOC.criteria: 2150 year BMI : 2539.9 kg/m2 LDLC : 100189.9 mg/dL Triglycerides > 350 mg/dL History myocardial infarction , stroke , diabetes mellitus , liver disease , kidney disease , thyroid disease High alcohol consumption ( < 14 drinks/week ) Use medication supplement lower blood lipid level ( i.e. , statin , fibrates , psyllium , fish oil capsule , soy lecithin , phytoestrogens ) Lactating , pregnant , want become pregnant study Weight loss gain ≥ 10 % body weight previous 6 month Eating Attitudes Test26 score > 20 Beck Depression InventoryII score ≥ 29 Gormally Cognitive Factors Related Binge Eating Scale score > 30 Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire score > 2
